Definitions.Paraphrase:
[C] (= dormitory) a large building in a college or university where students live 
宿舍楼
We four live in the same dorm. 
我们四个人住在同一栋宿舍楼。
We can go online in our dorm. 
我们在宿舍楼里可以上网。

spoken; not written 
口头的
He passed his English oral examination. 
他已经通过了英语口试。
They have made an oral agreement. 
他们已经达成了口头协议。

1. [C] a piece of equipment for heating a building 
（建筑物内的）暖气炉
It's cold in here — should I turn on the furnace？
这儿挺冷的，我可以把暖气炉打开吗？
2. [C] a container which is heated to a very high temperature, so that substances that are put inside it, such as metal, will melt or burn 
熔炉，火炉
People who work with furnaces in a steel factory need to wear protective clothing. 
炼钢厂工作在熔炉边的人们需要穿防护服。
This room is like a furnace! 
这房间简直像个大火炉！

[C] a device used for measuring temperature 
温度计，体温表
Last night the thermometer fell below freezing. 
昨夜温度计的读数降到冰点以下。

1. below zero 
零下
The temperature could fall to minus eight tonight. 
今晚温度会下降到零下八度。
2. made less by 
减
Seven minus three equals four (7-3 = 4).  
7减去3等于4。

1. negative; less than zero 
负的，零下的
a minus figure 
负数
2.（of marks or grades）of a standard slightly lower than the one stated
减
I got B minus (B-) in the test.
我在测试中得B减。

1. [C] a negative quantity 
负数
Two minuses make a plus. 
负负得正。
2. the minus sign (-) 
减号
Those pupils are learning to use the pluses and minuses. 
那些小学生正在学习使用加减号。

[C] a brass musical wind instrument 
小号
I was a trumpet player in the jazz band at school. 
在学校时我是爵士乐队的小号手。
He played a tune on his trumpet. 
他用小号吹奏了一支乐曲。

(cause to) shake slightly and quickly in a way that is felt rather than seen or heard 
震动，振动，抖动
If I drive my car too fast, the engine starts to vibrate. 
要是我开车太快了的话，发动机就开始颤抖。
Every sound that we hear is making part of our ears vibrate. 
我们听到的每个声音都会使我们耳朵的一部分发生振动。

1. produced without the use of chemical fertilizers 
不用化肥培植的，施用有机肥料的
He will only buy organic vegetables.
他只买有机肥料培植的蔬菜。
He claims that many people are discouraged from buying organic foods because of their high price. 
他声称因为价高，许多人不愿买有机肥料培植的食品。
2. of or produced by living things 
生物体的，有机体的
organic fertilizers 
有机肥料
A quarter of the contents of an average family's dustbin is organic matter. 
一个普通家庭的垃圾箱里有四分之一的东西是有机物质。

用有机肥料培植地
The wine is made from organically grown grapes. 
这酒是用有机肥料培植长成的葡萄制成的。

related to God and religion and therefore thought to be morally good 
神圣的，圣洁的
He reads the Holy Bible every night. 
他每晚都读《圣经》。
Jerusalem is a holy place to all Christians, Jews, and Muslims. 
耶路撒冷对基督教徒、犹太教徒和穆斯林来说都是一个神圣的地方。

[C] a type of small insect, thought of as hard-working 
蚂蚁
We've had another invasion of ants in the kitchen. 
我们的厨房又一次遭到蚂蚁的侵袭。

[C] a small flying insect that bites people and animals, and sucks their blood 
蚊子
Mosquitoes carry / spread disease.
蚊子会传播疾病。
Mosquitoes were flying about. 
蚊子飞来飞去。

[U, C] the short, fine hair of certain animals, or the skin of these animals, often used to make clothes, etc. for people 
（动物的）软毛，毛皮
a hat made of fur 
毛皮帽
Some people think the sale of furs should be banned. 
有些人认为应该禁止出售毛皮。
She stroked the rabbit's soft fur. 
她轻抚着兔子软软的毛。

[C] a small jumping animal, without a tail, that lives on land and in water 
蛙，蛙类动物
The frog startled him when it leaped from the garden into the kitchen. 
那青蛙从花园跳到厨房时，吓了他一跳。

1. no longer interesting or exciting because of having been heard, done, etc. too often before; not new 
没有新意的，过时的
She felt their relationship had lost its initial excitement and had become stale and predictable. 
她觉得他们的关系失去了起初的兴奋，变得平淡无奇。
He gave a boring speech full of stale jokes. 
他的发言很乏味，满是陈腐的笑话。
2. (esp. food) no longer fresh and often tasting or smelling unpleasant 
（食品）不新鲜的，走味的
stale bread 
陈面包
Coffee goes stale within a couple of weeks so it is best to buy it in small quantities. 
咖啡会在几个星期内走味，因此最好少量购买。

1. [U] the state of being depressed 
沮丧，意志消沉
I'm only just beginning to get over the deep depression I felt about losing my job. 
我刚刚开始摆脱失业带给我的深深沮丧。
She went through a long depression after she failed the examination. 
她考试不及格后消沉了很长一段时间。
2. [C] a period in which there is very little business activity and not many jobs 
萧条期，不景气
financial depression 
金融萧条时期
He was unemployed for many years during the depression of the 1930s. 
他在20世纪30年代大萧条时期失业多年。

1. endure sb. or sth. without complaining; put up with 
忍耐
tolerate heat / noise / pain 
忍耐高温/噪音/疼痛
I can't tolerate excessive heat. 
我耐不住特别高的气温。
2. allow sth. that one does not like or agree with to happen or continue 
容忍
The school cannot tolerate cheating on exams. 
学校不容许考试作弊。
I'm afraid I can't tolerate that sort of behavior in my class. 
恐怕我不能容忍我的班里有那种行为。

[C] a student who is studying for their first degree at college or university 
大学本科生，（尚未获学士学位的）大学生
Cambridge undergraduates 
剑桥大学本科生
undergraduate courses 
本科生课程

1. [C] a musical record or a compact disc 
唱片或光盘
This recording is available on disk and on cassette. 
这个录音材料有光盘和盒带。
2. [C] a flat circular device, usu. inside a square container, which has magnetic covering and is used for storing computer information 
计算机磁盘
Store the data on both the hard disk and the floppy disk. 
把数据同时储存在硬盘和软盘上。

1. divide a place into several parts 
把……分隔开
They sawed the hall into small rooms. 
他们把大厅分隔成小房间。
2. cut sth. with a tool that has a  long blade with sharp teeth on one of its edges 
锯，锯开
I'll saw the logs up into smaller pieces. 
我要将原木锯成小木块。
We'll have to saw that tree down. 
我们得把那棵树锯倒。

[C] a tool that has a long blade with sharp teeth on one of its edges 
锯
a hand saw 
手锯
He used a saw to cut the wood. 
他用锯锯木头。

existing as an idea, feeling or quality, not as a material object, or (of an argument, discussion, etc.) general, not based on particular examples 
抽象的
Truth and beauty are abstract concepts. 
真与美是抽象概念。
This debate is too abstract — let's have some hard facts! 
这场辩论太抽象了——举一些有力的事实吧！

1.[C] general ideas 
抽象概念，概括
I have difficulty in dealing with the abstract. 
我对付抽象概念有困难。
2.[C] a short summary of a book, etc. 
摘要，提要
He made an abstract of the lecture. 
他为讲座写了摘要。

[C] a mountain with a large circular hole at the top through which hot liquid rocks, gases, steam and dust are or have been forced out 
火山
Volcanoes discharge massive quantities of dust into the stratosphere. 
火山喷射出大量的灰尘进入大气平流层。

use (sth.) for help, because one cannot find any other way of acting 
求助，采用
I had to resort to violence to get my money. 
我不得不借助暴力来取回我的钱。
When she didn't answer the telephone I resorted to standing outside her window and calling up to her. 
当她不接电话时，我就只得站在她的窗外喊她。

[C] a group of people who have been chosen to listen to all the facts in a trial in a law court and to decide whether a claim has been proven 
陪审团
Several members of the jury wept as they heard how the child was killed. 
当听到孩子被杀害的经过时，几名陪审团成员落了泪。
The jury is / are still out. 
陪审团还在考虑他们的判决。

despite what has just been said or referred to 
不过，仍然
I disagree with everything she said, but she's a very good speaker nevertheless. 
她所说的一切我不敢苟同，不过她仍然是很好的演说家。
I am feeling ill, but I shall come with you nevertheless.
我感到不舒服，可我仍会跟你一起去。

1. [U] a state of untidiness and lack of organization 
混乱状态
The whole office was in a state of disorder — she couldn't find a thing she looked for. 
整个办公室乱糟糟的，要找的东西她一样也找不到。
2. [U] an angry, possibly violent, expression of dissatisfaction by crowds of people, esp. about a political matter 
骚乱，暴乱
The trial was kept secret because of the risk of public disorder.
因为生怕引起公众的骚乱，审判是保密的。

1. [U] the choosing of things or people 
选择
Success is achieved by the careful selection of projects. 
成功靠的是仔细甄选计划而取得的。
After some discussion, we made our selection. 
经过一番讨论，我们做出了选择。
2. [C] a choice, range or variety of sth. 
可供挑选的东西
Most schools would have a good selection of these books in their libraries. 
大部分学校的图书馆都有许多这样的书供选择。
The larger shops are able to stock a wider selection of goods. 
大商店能储存大量的各类货物。

say or shout sth. suddenly because of surprise, fear, pleasure, etc. 
（由于惊奇、害怕、欢欣等）呼喊，惊叫
"You can't leave so soon!" she exclaimed. 
"你不能这么早离开！"她叫道。
She exclaimed in delight upon hearing the news. 
她听到这个消息高兴地欢呼起来。

[U] a game for two, played with thirty-two pieces on a board with sixty-four black and white squares 
国际象棋
They often play chess after work. 
他们下班后常下国际象棋。
The aim in chess is to win by attacking the other player's king in such a way that it cannot avoid being taken. 
国际象棋的目标是攻击对方的王，使其只得被吃掉。

1. feel or touch clumsily, rudely or indecently 
翻找，笨拙地触摸
He pawed through reference books. 
他翻找一本本的参考书。
She pawed through her purse for matches. 
她在手提包里乱翻一气找火柴。
2. touch, hit, etc. with the foot 
（用脚爪等）抓，扒
The dog began pawing (at) the ground in excitement. 
这狗开始兴奋地用爪子抓地。

1. [C] the foot of an animal such as a cat, dog or bear which has claws or nails 
脚爪，爪子
The cat lifted its paw and put it on my knee. 
猫抬起爪子放在我的膝上。
2. [C] a human hand 
手
Take your filthy paws off my nice clean washing! 
把你的脏手从我洗得干干净净的衣物上拿开！

[U] the money that one pays for sending letters and parcels through the post
邮资，邮费
Enclose $20 plus $2 postage.
随信附寄20美元，外加2美元邮资。
What is the postage for an air mail letter? 
寄一封航空信的邮资是多少？

crush (food) into smaller, softer pieces with teeth so that it is easier to swallow; bite sth. with teeth, usu. to taste its flavor 
咀嚼，嚼，咬
You should chew your food well before you swallow it. 
你应当先细嚼你的食物，然后再咽下去。
He broke off another piece of bread and chewed at it. 
他又撕下一块面包嚼了起来。

1. [C] a small piece cut or broken off from glass, stone, wood, etc. 
片屑，碎片
chocolate chips 
巧克力碎片
The ground was covered with wood chips. 
地上铺满了木屑。
2. (usu. pl.)a long thin piece of potato that is fried and usu. eaten hot 
炸薯条
This restaurant serves excellent fish and chips. 
这家餐馆供应上好的炸鱼和炸薯条。
3. microchip 
芯片
The silicon chip is said to be the invention that has changed the lifestyles in the 20th century. 
人们认为硅片是改变了20世纪生活方式的发明。

(cause to) lose a small piece from the surface or edge, e.g. by breaking or dropping 
（使）削下碎片
This saucer chips easily. 
这个杯碟很容易碰破。
I'm sorry I have chipped a piece off your glass.
对不起，我把玻璃杯碰破了一个缺口。

1. hit quickly with the flat part of the hand
用巴掌打，拍打
She slapped him across the face.
她抽了他一耳光。
She slapped his face when he put his hand on her knee. 
当他将手放在她的膝盖上时，她打了他一记耳光。
2. move against (a surface) with a sound like a slap 
啪啪地撞击，拍击 
He slapped the document down on the desk. 
他把文件啪的一声往桌上一扔。

[C] a quick hit with the flat part of the hand 
掴，掌击
He gave the child a slap on the back. 
他在孩子的背上打了一巴掌。
Her husband has been slapping her around, but she's afraid to go to the police. 
她丈夫不断地打她，但她不敢报警。

Definitions.PartofSpeech:
make an independent effort 
独立闯新路，独立开创
He decided to leave the company to strike out on his own as a writer. 
他决定离开公司，自己去闯一条写作的新路。
At the age of 17 she left her home to strike out on her own. 
17岁那年，她离开了家去独立闯天下。

form or have a friendly relationship with 
与……相处融洽
They just can't get along with each other. 
他们就是彼此合不来。
He doesn't get along with anybody in the office. 
他和办公室的任何人都处不来。

fight or argue about 
因……打仗，因……而争吵
They warred over trivial matters. 
他们因小事而争吵。
Mike and John are warring over who is to marry Mary. 
迈克和约翰正在为谁该娶玛丽而争吵。

vary from… to 
在从……到……范围或幅度内变动或变化
Prices range from $25 to $75. 
价格从25美元至75美元不等。
The underwater shots range from interesting to breathtaking. 
水下镜头有趣惊险，无奇不有。

(of a supply of water, gas, electricity, etc.) (cause to) stop working by a switch of control 
关（水源、煤气、电等）
The tap won't turn off. 
水龙头关不上。
Please turn off the wireless. 
请把无线电关上。

admit defeat in one's efforts to affect, harm, change, improve, etc. 
对……表示绝望 
I give up on you: you'll never be a qualified nurse. 
我对你不再抱任何希望，你永远成不了合格的护士。
His teachers seem to have given up on him. 
他的老师们看来已对他绝望。

soon 
不久，很快
Class will be over before long. 
快要下课了。
We'll know the truth before long. 
我们很快就会知道真相的。

increase (a flame, sound, etc.) 
开大，调高（火焰、声音等）
Turn up the radio.
把收音机开响些。
The air-conditioning unit was turned up too high.
空调开得太大了。

cut (sth.) into small pieces 
切碎，割碎
Cut up the carrots and put them into the pot. 
把胡萝卜切碎放入锅内。
He cut up the meat on his plate. 
他把自己盘子里的肉切碎。

(cause to) reach (an unfavorable end); finish by becoming or by doing sth. 
结束，告终 
He ended up as head of the firm. 
他最后成了商行的主管人。
Wasteful people usually end up in debt. 
挥霍浪费者最后往往负债。

have its or one's origin in (usu. sth.)
源于，从……产生出来 
The river springs from a lake. 
这条河的源头是一个湖。
All our errors have sprung from carelessness. 
我们所有的错误都是由粗心造成的。

cause serious arguments in an organization, group, etc. 
使……分裂
It was the misunderstanding that tore them apart. 
是误解导致了他们的分离。

make use of (sth. or doing sth., often sth. unpleasant or unpopular) to gain an advantage, often when everything else has failed 
凭借，求助，诉诸
If persuasion won't work, we may have to resort to force. 
如果说服工作不见效，我们可能只得诉诸武力。
Don't resort to punishment to make a child obey. 
不要采用惩罚的方式叫孩子听话。

if it happens that; lest 
以防万一 
Be quiet in case you wake the baby. 
轻点儿，免得弄醒孩子。
Keep the window closed in case it rains. 
把窗子关好，以防下雨。

prevent (sth. unpleasant, or sb. from reaching an unpleasant subject)
阻止，拦住
He will get into trouble if we don't head him off. 
如果我们不阻拦他，他会遇到麻烦。
We tried our best to head Henry off the topic, because we knew he'd reveal confidential information. 
我们尽全力阻止亨利谈这个话题，因为我们知道他会泄密的。

because of a particular fact or situation 
在……基础上，根据……原则
She was given the job on the basis of her qualifications. 
由于她的资历，她得到了那份工作。
It's dangerous to judge on the basis of first impressions. 
根据第一印象做判断是很危险的。

write what is necessary on (sth. such as a paper) 
把……填进去，把（表格等）填好 
Fill in the blanks to complete the following sentences. 
填空完成下面的句子。
He was required to fill in a form before the interview. 
面试前，他被要求填一张表格。

give a short account of (sth.); give the main ideas of (sth. written or spoken); repeat the chief facts 
总结，概括 
The judge summed up the evidence presented. 
法官概括了呈堂证据。
I can't sum up his whole philosophy in one sentence. 
我无法用一句话来概括他的全部哲学。

in spite of the difficulties that would usu. make sth. impossible；very unexpectedly 
尽管有极大的困难，出乎意料地
Against all (the) odds, he made a full recovery.
他出乎意料地完全康复了。
Against all (the) odds, I finished my work in time. 
尽管有极大的困难，我还是按时完成了工作。
宾夕法尼亚州（美国州名）
